definition: collectivization of agriculture (disastrous policy of communist Russia around 1930 and China in the 1950s)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: During the Great Leap Forward in 1958, people rushed headlong into mass action to establish people's communes.
sentences.chinese: 一九五八年“大跃进”，一哄而起搞人民公社化。

sentences.english: The disaster from the Great Leap Forward and the Chinese rural people's commune movement.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难源自大跃进和中国农村人民公社化运动。

sentences.english: From 1959, the pastoral areas practiced people's commune .
sentences.chinese: 1959年牧区全面实行了人民公社化。

definition: fixing of farm output quotas for each household

pinyin: nong2 ye4 sheng1 chan3 he2 zuo4 she4

definition: land reform/same as 土地改革[tu3 di4 gai3 ge2]
the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party
Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), Mao's attempt to modernize China's economy, which resulted in economic devastation, and millions of deaths from famine caused by misguided policies
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
after liberation (i.e. after the Communist's victory)/after the establishment of PRC in 1949
Socialist Education Movement (1963-66), formal name of the Four Cleanups Movement 四清運動|四清运动[Si4 qing1 Yun4 dong4]
pinyin: She4 hui4 Zhu3 yi4 Jiao4 yu4 Yun4 dong4
